pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:5.1: 26. The training rule on sitting with clasped knees
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were clasping their knees while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:7.2: “‘I will not clasp my knees while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not clasp one’s knees.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, clasps his knees with his hands or with a cloth while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:9.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:10.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
